title: Drawing, "Part of the design for a bowl", 1600
medium: Charcoal, pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on craim paper, laid down
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A fantastical ship is shown from the side, supported with a foot surrounded by dolphins. Ornaments, including scrolls and acanthus leaves, cover all surfaces. A lansquenet (soldier) stands on the gunwale (top of boat). A spread eagle, caryatid and orb ornament the quarterdeck at rear, above a scrolling handle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Part of the design for a bowl", 1600.
1600. Charcoal, pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on craim paper, laid down. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6110.
